sub_title: Senior advisor Marine and Coastal Management
summary:
Bas Bolman is a senior advisor at Deltares since 2017. He develops and implements international projects relating to fisheries and aquaculture. These projects are integrated and multidisciplinary by nature and often connect to topics such marine governance, Blue Economy (BE), Integrated Coastal Zone Management (ICZM), Marine Spatial Planning (MSP), climate change and multi-use. In BE/ICZM/MSP processes he is often involved in framework and indicator development in interaction with policy makers and other stakeholders. 

In 2021/2022 he has managed the World Bank project Comoros Country Environmental Assessment. In 2021 he successfully completed a World Bank project in Seychelles. It entailed the "Support for articulating the BE and coastal adaptation investment priorities for Seychelles’ climate resilience". In 2020 he was project leader to the support of the government of Mozambique to develop a sustainable BE roadmap (clients: World Bank and ProAzul). Another recently completed project is the BE Sustainability Framework with criteria and indicators for blue economy sectors inside and outside the EU (client: EASME / DG MARE). From 2017-2020 Bolman was involved in the development of indicators for the Kuwait ICZM framework. 

From 2014-2017 Bolman was a researcher at Wageningen Economic Research, implementing marine governance and aquaculture projects. Bolman was responsible for building public-private partnerships with the seafood industry, NGOs and governments to enable more sustainability in aquaculture supply chains in Ghana, Kenya, Bangladesh, Myanmar and Indonesia. He was also a work package leader of the Horizon 2020 project SUCCESS, focussing on the competitiveness of European fisheries and aquaculture. Furthermore Bolman was involved in the H2020 project MARIBE, aiming to unlock the potential of multi-use of space in the Blue Economy. From 2010-2014 he worked for IMARES. Amongst others he was a work package leader for the FP7 project COEXIST, focussing on a better integration of fisheries, aquaculture and other activities in the coastal zone. From 2008-2010 he has been setting up public-private partnerships at the Dutch Ministry of Fisheries, aiming to work towards innovative techniques for sustainable fisheries and aquaculture.

treasury_media.title: Seychelles Revises Climate Commitment to Include Blue Economy and Coastal Adaptation
Sustainable Blue Economy
treasury_media.description:
The importance of the Blue Economy is increasing quickly in the global economies. There is a better recognition of the potential of Blue Economy to give impulse to economic development, employment and innovation. Importantly, a sustainable Blue Economy can play a central role in alleviating the pressures on land resources, offering new possibilities to local communities and fostering climate change mitigation and adaptation.
More information: https://bit.ly/3FgqDZ8

treasury_media.title: Eco engineering to prevent flooding in Bangladesh (ECOBAS) | Wageningen UR
treasury_media.description: In the project ECOBAS, eco engineering is used to protect the coast of Bangladesh. Every year, floods wash away the earthen dikes along the Bangladeshi coast. A barrier could be built in the sea to break the waves. Natural processes could be used to help build this barrier.

treasury_media.title: Knowledge for a sustainable Arctic
treasury_media.description: Marine biologist Martine van den Heuvel-Greve from Wageningen Marine Research talks about her research on possible effects of new activities in the Arctic. By developing new knowledge, she hopes to contribute to the international dialogue on how and where new activities can take place.

projects.title: Support for articulating  the Blue Economy and coastal adaptation investment priorities for Seychelles’ climate resilience
projects.description:
Location: Seychelles
Client: Ministry of Environment, Energy and Climate Change & World Bank
Main project features: To support the revision of the Seychelles’ Nationally Determined Contributions (NDC) with a specific focus on Blue Economy.
Positions held: Senior researcher
Activities performed: 1) draft sections of the NDC to incorporate the various aspects of Blue Economy in the adaption and mitigation section and for various sectors, and 2) contribute to draft the National Adaptation plan outlining clear priorities for investment from the Blue Economy and coastal adaptation perspective, essential to achieve climate resilience in the Seychelles.

projects.title: Capacity building for sustainable aquaculture and fisheries development in Myanmar
projects.description: The objective was to analyse Myanmar’s aquaculture and fisheries knowledge infrastructure including a gap analysis. Future needs were identified and improvements were recommended in terms of capacity building. Bolman was involved in visiting universities to assess aquaculture education.

projects.title: Feasibility study for aquaculture in Ghana
projects.description: The aim of the field work and desk study was to assess the feasibility of the formation and set-up of one or more Public Private Partnerships (PPPs) for aquaculture in Ghana. The project consisted of two phases: 1) a mission to Ghana to conduct an aquaculture value chain analysis and 2) develop business cases for investments in aquaculture in Ghana. Bolman’s role was to collect socio-economic data and to process these in the report and business cases.

projects.title: Comoros Country Environmental Analysis
projects.description: The objective of this project was to support the World Bank with the preparation of the first Country Environmental Analysis (CEA) for Comoros and related engagement and dissemination materials and activities.  This CEA calls for transformative changes towards sustainable management of natural resources, to achieve long-term poverty alleviation and resilience. In addition, this CEA recommends strengthening the legal and institutional framework, improving institutional capacities, enhancing resources for environmental management, and completing the decentralization process.
